summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, dated October 8, 2021, instructing someone to move a folder to a 'non testifying' (NTW) location and to create a 3500 folder for a FedEx records custodian named 'aho' for review. It appears to be internal case management communication regarding evidence organization.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, instructing someone to move a folder to a 'non testifying' location and create a 3500 folder for a FedEx records custodian.

persons.name: aho
persons.context: Identified as the FedEx records custodian; the AUSA requests a 3500 folder be created for her.

connections.description: The AUSA is requesting the creation of a 3500 folder for the FedEx records custodian 'aho', indicating she is a potential witness or source of records for the prosecution.

events.title: Internal Case Management Instruction
events.description: An AUSA sends an email instructing a colleague to move a folder to a 'non testifying' location and to create a 3500 folder for a FedEx records custodian.

keyFacts: An Assistant U.S. Attorney in the SDNY is managing case evidence, specifically requesting a folder be moved to a 'non testifying' (NTW) location.
The AUSA identifies a FedEx records custodian named 'aho' and requests a 3500 folder be created for her, suggesting her records are relevant to the case.
The communication is dated October 2021, indicating ongoing case preparation or management activity well after Epstein's death.
